analyzed: de ltar don che ba yin no // su la la bzhi pa rab kyi mtha' gnas yid la byed pa sangs @347b rgyas rjes su dran pa 'di de ltar thos pa tsam rna lam du thos pa de la mi'am mi ma yin pa'i bar de nye bar brtags nas dad pa dang / dga' ba dang /
translated: Thus, it is of great benefit.

original: mchog tu dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba skye'o //
translated: Whoever hears this recollection of the Buddha, this attention to the fourth absorption at the peak of existence, merely by hearing it with the ears, whether human or non-human, having examined it, will give rise to faith, joy, and supreme joy.

original: de btson ra'i 'ching ba dam po las yongs su thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de btson ra'i 'ching ba dam po las yongs su thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be completely liberated from the tight bonds of prison.

original: gang su dag sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i sems can thams cad kyang sdug bsngal dag las yongs su thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang su dag sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i sems can thams cad kyang sdug bsngal dag las yongs su thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: All sentient beings who are suffering will be completely liberated from suffering.

original: longs spyod kyi sdug bsngal dang / chad pa dang / brdeg pa dang / g-yang sa dang / me dang / chu dang / dug dang / dgra thams cad dang / 'byung po thams cad dang / nad kyi 'jigs pa dang / gnas kyi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi sdug bsngal dang / chad pa dang / brdeg pa dang / g-yang sa dang / me dang / chu dang / dug dang / dgra thams cad dang / 'byung po thams cad dang / nad kyi 'jigs pa dang / gnas kyi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: All sufferings of enjoyments, all punishments, beatings, precipices, fires, waters, poisons, enemies, all spirits, fears of illness, fears of abodes,

original: rgyal po'i 'jigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas bran gyi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i bar dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i bar las yongs su thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po'i 'jigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas bran gyi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i bar dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i bar las yongs su thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be completely freed from the fear of kings, from the fear of robbers, from the fear of fire, from the fear of water, from the fear of weapons, from the fear of enemies, from the fear of the lower realms,

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //🔽su sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de lta ba thos pa tsam rna lam du grags na de la nye bar rtags nas dad pa skyes de ltar don che zhing phan yon che ba yin na /
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro // su sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de lta ba thos pa tsam rna lam du grags na de la nye bar rtags nas dad pa skyes de ltar don che zhing phan yon che ba yin na /
translated: and will become the cause for going to the higher realms.🔽If one who merely sees or hears the name of the Buddha will give rise to faith upon hearing it, how much more so for one who contemplates it as taught?

original: su ji ltar bstan pa bzhin de bzhin du sgom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: su ji ltar bstan pa bzhin de bzhin du sgom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /

analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na sngon yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dkrigs pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa drug ni /
translated: When this Dharma teaching was explained, 8,600,000,000,000 beings who had previously purified themselves

analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i ting nge 'dzin de thob par gyur to //

analyzed: ji ltar sngar bshad pa bzhin du yon tan de dag dang yang ldan par gyur to //

analyzed: da'i tshe srog chags khrag khrig phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi ni /

analyzed: @348a *// sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //

analyzed: de'i tshe sems can dpag yas pa kha cig ni /

analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor dang / 'bras bu dang po la gnas par gyur to //

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some

analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar thob par gyur to //

original: de'i tshe sems can dpag yas pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe sems can dpag yas pa ni /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngon ma bskyed pa'i sems bskyed do //
translated: generated the mind that had not previously been generated for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

translated: And those five hundred daughters of Mara, beginning with Vimalaprabha, by the power of the Buddha, while remaining in the abode of Mara, heard all this prophecy of the purification of the mind through recollection of the Buddha.

analyzed: thos nas kyang bud med kyi dngos po mi snang bar gyur te skyes pa nyid thob bo //
translated: And having heard it, they lost their female organs and attained the state of being males.

analyzed: gang dag sngon yongs su sbyang ba byas pa de dag thams cad sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan par gyur to //

analyzed: ji skad bshad pa bzhin du yon tan de dag dang ldan par gyur to //

translated: Surrounded by many hundreds of millions of musical instruments and cymbals, they descended from the inconceivable array of the abode of Māra to the presence of the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das de la lha rdzas kyi me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dag dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dag dang / rin po che'i ras bcos pu dang / chos gos sna tshogs gtor cing mngon par gtor te bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //🔽'phags pa 'dus pa chen po nyi ma'i snying po'i le'u bcu gcig pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la lha rdzas kyi me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dag dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dag dang / rin po che'i ras bcos pu dang / chos gos sna tshogs gtor cing mngon par gtor te bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do // 'phags pa 'dus pa chen po nyi ma'i snying po'i le'u bcu gcig pa las /
translated: They scattered divine flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, parasols, victory banners, flags, precious silk garments, and various Dharma robes over the Blessed One. They circumambulated the Blessed One three times and, bowing their heads to his two feet, they sat to one side.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i le'u ste dgu pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i le'u ste dgu pa rdzogs so ////
translated: This concludes the ninth chapter of the Eleven-Chaptered Section of the Noble Great Collection, the chapter on the recollection of the Buddha.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skar ma la dga' ba la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skar ma la dga' ba la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Jyotīrasa,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: lag 'gro'i tshogs thams cad kyi zhal ta byos shig ces bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems kyis gsol pa /
analyzed: lag 'gro'i tshogs thams cad kyi zhal ta byos shig ces bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems kyis gsol pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, You should serve the entire assembly of yakṣas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dus lags kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dus lags kyi /
translated: With a mind free from afflictions, he said, Blessed One, it is time.

original: gshegs shig / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gshegs shig / bcom ldan 'das /

original: gang khyod kyis mdzad pa mdzod cig /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gang khyod kyis mdzad pa mdzod cig / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Blessed One said, Son of noble family,

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pas lag 'gro'i las bstan pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su 'byang ba lung bstan pa bshad pa rab tu bstan pa'i dus yin no //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pas lag 'gro'i las bstan pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su 'byang ba lung bstan pa bshad pa rab tu bstan pa'i dus yin no //
translated: it is time to explain the inconceivable deeds of the Tathāgata, the purification of the yakṣas, the prophecy, the teaching, and the demonstration.

original: yang de'i tshe lha thams cad ces bya ba nas grul bum thams cad ces bya ba'i bar dag me tog dang / spos dang / rin po che dang / @349a *//
analyzed: yang de'i tshe lha thams cad ces bya ba nas grul bum thams cad ces bya ba'i bar dag me tog dang / spos dang / rin po che dang / @349a *//
translated: At that time, all the gods, up to all the kumbhāṇḍas, with flowers, incense, precious substances,🔽and various musical instruments, made offerings to the Blessed One and said, Blessed One, please go.

original: ras bcos bu dang / chos gos dang / rgyan dang / spud pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyi char pa dag rab tu 'bebs shing sil snyan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi ril mo'i sgra 'byin pa la mi dang mi ma yin pa thams cad kyis bsngags pa'i yon tan gyis bstod nas bcom ldan 'das gdan las mngon par bzhengs te ri'i
analyzed: ras bcos bu dang / chos gos dang / rgyan dang / spud pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyi char pa dag rab tu 'bebs shing sil snyan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi ril mo'i sgra 'byin pa la mi dang mi ma yin pa thams cad kyis bsngags pa'i yon tan gyis bstod nas bcom ldan 'das gdan las mngon par bzhengs te ri'i
translated: and a rain of cotton, Dharma robes, ornaments, jewelry, parasols, victory banners, and flags fell. The sound of quintillions of cymbals resounded. All humans and nonhumans praised him with the qualities of his praise. The Bhagavān rose from his seat and went to the top of Mount Sumeru.

original: rgyal po ri rab ga la bar byang phyogs su nye bar gshegs so //
analyzed: rgyal po ri rab ga la bar byang phyogs su nye bar gshegs so //
translated: and a rain of silk garments, Dharma robes, ornaments, jewelry, parasols, victory banners, and flags fell. The sound of quintillions of musical instruments resounded. All humans and non-humans praised him with the qualities of praise. The Blessed One rose from his seat and went to the north, to the peak of Mount Sumeru.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha thams cad kyis kyang gang bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bdar cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyis yongs su bskor te ri rab kyi rtse mor gshegs par bzhed par shes so //

translated: All the gods of the desire realm and the form realm knew that the Blessed One, with the saṅgha of hearers in front and surrounded by the saṅgha of bodhisattvas, was going to the peak of Mount Sumeru.

translated: Having understood this, Brahma, lord of a thousand worlds, emanated a staircase made of the seven precious substances, covered with various silks and divine precious flowers, and said this:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi them skas las gshegs par gsol /

analyzed: lha'i bu yongs su dga' ldan gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir lha rdzas kyi bee d'urya'i them skas dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i tsandan gyi phye ma sna tshogs bkram pa sprul nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The god Sunirmita emanated a staircase made of divine beryl and strewn with various sandalwood powders for the Blessed One and said:

translated: The god Santuṣita emanated a staircase made of divine beryl and strewn with various divine powders for the Blessed One and said:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi them skas las gshegs par gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi them skas las gshegs par gsol /
translated: “Blessed One, please come down by our staircase.”

translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, emanated a staircase of red pearls for the Blessed One, covered with various divine sandalwood powders and various jeweled nets, and said this:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi them skas las gshegs par gsol /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gi them skas las ri rab kyi rtse mor gshegs par gsol /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gi them skas las ri rab kyi rtse mor gshegs par gsol /
translated: “Blessed One, please ascend to the peak of Mount Sumeru by way of our staircase.”

translated: Then, out of compassion for them, the Blessed One emanated six bodies of a buddha like himself. The seven buddhas, with the lord of the gods and the lord of the asuras in front, and surrounded by the saṅgha of hearers and the saṅgha of bodhisattvas, the Blessed One went to the peak of Mount Sumeru in such a great array.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bdun po de dag mchog tu lhan ne lhang nger ri rab kyi rtse mo na bzhugs so //
translated: Those seven buddhas were sitting on the peak of Mount Sumeru, shining with a supreme radiance.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku re re las 'od zer 'di lta bu byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku re re las 'od zer 'di lta bu byung ste /
